div.span: With the President's update, Lynchburg-Clay Local Schools will remain closed through
We thank you for your patience at this time.

span.div: Food distribution will now be available to all children under the age of 18 beginning Monday, March 23.
Please follow the link below to sign up.
Also see the information by clicking on the More link.

h3.span: Events and Practices Canceled March 16 - May 1, 2020

strong.span: All SHAC athletic events and practices are cancelled.
All School events (FFA, FCCLA, Band, etc. are also cancelled.

h3.span: District Owned Used Busses and Minivans for Sale

span.div: Please click on the more link to see information and pictures.

span.strong: Contact Ryan Collins, Transportation Supervisor @ 937-364-6065 for more information.

h3.span: Middle School and HIgh School Pep Band Performs at Wilmington College

span.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

span.span: Last week, the LCHS Pep Band played at Wilmington College for the Mental and Developmental Disability organization of Clinton County. 8th graders joined the High School Band for a fun night of tunes!

span.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

span.span: The girls varsity bowling team qualified 3rd out of the 21 team sectional tournament last week to bowl in the district tournament on Friday February 21st. In the district tournament Mikaela Tipton finished in 2nd place overall for the district tournament earning a medal for individual runner-up. Mikaela bowled a 528 series with a high game score of 215.

span.div: Proceeds from the Show benefit Empower Youth

h3.span: LCHS Lady Mustangs Bowling Team Finishes 2nd in Tournament

span.style: font-family: Calibri, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; background-color: #ffffff

span.span: The Lynchburg-Clay girls bowling team competed in a tournament at Highland Lanes Bowling Center on Monday January 20th

h3.span: LCHS Senior Zoe Fittro Joins 1,000 point Club
Construction at the HS requires using alternate parking lot during Boys Basketball

span.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff;font-size:16px

span.strong: For boys games, if fans arrive after 6:30, we are requesting that they use the parking lot between the high school and elementary school as much as possible.
